Class UserCollection

UserCollection Class

Represents a collection of User objects, and provides additional means for loading events and filtering.

Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Collection
UserFrosting\UserCollection
Namespace: UserFrosting
Package: UserFrosting
Author: Alex Weissman
Link: http://www.userfrosting.com/navigating/#structure
Located at models/collections/UserCollection.php

Methods summary

public array
# getRecentEvents( string $type, string $field_name = null )

Get a list of the most recent event of a given type (e.g., "sign_in") for each user.

Get a list of the most recent event of a given type (e.g., "sign_in") for each user.

On success, this will set the event times for the specified event type as attributes of the User models. Unfortunately, we can't store $recent_event_times directly in the collection, because it won't get copied in other operations. So, it must be returned by this method instead.

Parameters

$type
The type of event, matching the event_type field in the user_event table.
$field_name
optional The attribute name to use for this event in the User model. If not specified, defaults to last_{$type}_time.

Returns

array
An array of datetime strings, keyed by the id of each User.

See

https://github.com/laravel/framework/issues/10695
public UserFrosting\UserCollection
# filterRecentEventTime( string $type, array $event_times, string $value, string $format_zero = "Brand New!", string $format = "l F j, Y g:i a" )

Filter this collection based on a recent event time.

Filter this collection based on a recent event time.

This method allows you to filter Users by recent event times. For example, you may filter users by their last sign-in time, last sign-up time, last activation request time, etc.

Parameters

$type
The type of event, matching the event_type field in the user_event table.
$event_times
An array of datetimes, indexed by the Users' ids. This is typically the output of getRecentEvents().
$value
The value to search for. This filter does a simple stripos for searching.
$format_zero
optional The date format to use when searching zero-valued dates.
$format
optional The date format to use when searching non-zero dates. By default lets you search weekday, month, day, year, etc.

Returns

UserFrosting\UserCollection
The modified UserCollection.
public UserFrosting\UserCollection
# filterTextField( string $name, string $value )

Filter this collection based on a specified User field.

Filter this collection based on a specified User field.

This method allows you to filter Users by any User field, such as user_name, email, etc.

Parameters

$name
The name of the User field to filter by.
$value
The value to search for. This filter does a simple stripos for searching.

Returns

UserFrosting\UserCollection
The modified UserCollection.
